posts.raw_content:
to help me decide which church I might begin attending.

I was very disappointed. 

Out of the 11, only 6 mentioned the event, and only 4 spoke Charlie Kirk's name, and only 2 spent more than 3 minutes on the topic.  

All 6 couched the assassination among other bad events (school shooting, Russia/Ukraine/Poland, 9/11 anniversary, Israel/Qatar).  The only one that spent significant time on Charlie, honored his family, and related him to Jesus being persecuted for spoken words, also pandered to both sides a lot and felt weak and cowardly for not taking a definitive stand or addressing the matter that I need the most spiritual help with: the size and scope of the eruption of demonic evil we're witnessing in society in response to the event.  (Plus the music was so sappy and corny.)

Now I'm very unmotivated to start attending mass/service. Which makes me sad.

Any advice?

(Oh and BTW, the Episcopalian church was fucking disgusting.  The female priest never mentioned the assassination, but said we are living in difficult times because there was a "Nazi rally" in her home town, and boasted about being a "social justice warrior" because that what Christianity is.)
posts.author: teleomorph
posts.title: Today was going to be the day I started going to church, but at the last minute, I decided to stay home and watch or skim the livestreams from 11 nearby churches, to see how each addressed this week...
posts.content:
to help me decide which church I might begin attending.

I was very disappointed.

Out of the 11, only 6 mentioned the event, and only 4 spoke Charlie Kirk's name, and only 2 spent more than 3 minutes on the topic.

All 6 couched the assassination among other bad events (school shooting, Russia/Ukraine/Poland, 9/11 anniversary, Israel/Qatar). The only one that spent significant time on Charlie, honored his family, and related him to Jesus being persecuted for spoken words, also pandered to both sides a lot and felt weak and cowardly for not taking a definitive stand or addressing the matter that I need the most spiritual help with: the size and scope of the eruption of demonic evil we're witnessing in society in response to the event. (Plus the music was so sappy and corny.)

Now I'm very unmotivated to start attending mass/service. Which makes me sad.

Any advice?

(Oh and BTW, the Episcopalian church was fucking disgusting. The female priest never mentioned the assassination, but said we are living in difficult times because there was a "Nazi rally" in her home town, and boasted about being a "social justice warrior" because that what Christianity is.)
